description.raw:
Ported selection buffer from ogre v1, which is needed for mouse picking. The implementation is different from v1 due to  API changes and a v1 feature that’s no longer supported in ogre so I had to implement my own.  

The ogre2 demo has been extended to print out the visual being selected by the mouse.

More details:

Mouse picking is done by assigning a unique color to each visual. At run time, the pixel picked by the mouse will then be used to identify the visual associated with that pixel color. This was achieved using ogre “material schemes” in ogre v1, which switches visual materials to their unique color during a mouse click. However, it’s no longer supported in v2 and I had to implement my own logic in Ogre2MaterialSwitcher class \(in pre and posRenderTargetUpdate functions\) for doing this. I added a note about performance profiling in there as switching ogre materials could be expensive in v2. Since we don’t do it often \(only on mouse clicks\) I think it’s fine for now but will keep an eye on it.

title: Ogre2: Support mouse picking
